xf:input.xf:label: XLink:
xf:input.xf:hint: The xlink attribute is used to reference an external resource, such as a second metadata record, such as a Related Item or a Table Of Contents.

xf:select1.xf:label: Type:
xf:select1.xf:hint: There is no controlled list of types for Access Condition defined. Suggested values are: restriction on access (equivalent to MARC 21 field 506) and use and reproduction (equivalent to MARC 21 field 540).

xf:select1.xf:label: Authority:
xf:select1.xf:hint: The name of the authoritative list for a controlled value is recorded here. An authority attribute may be used to indicate that a title is controlled by a record in an authority file (e.g. authority="naf").

xf:select1.xf:label: Language:
xf:select1.xf:hint: This attribute is used to specify the language used within individual elements, using the codes from ISO 639-2/b. This is equivalent to authority="iso639-2b" used with Language (which gives a language of the resource described in the record), but is applied to the language used as content of the metadata elements.

xf:select1.xf:label: xml:lang:
xf:select1.xf:hint: This attribute is used to specify the language used within individual elements, using specifications in RFC 3066. RFC 3066 ("Request for Comments," which defines Internet practice) uses the two-character ISO 639-1 codes along with three-character ISO 639-2 codes for those languages not given in 639-1. This is equivalent to authority="rfc3066" used with the Language element (which gives a language of the resource described in the record), but is applied to the language used as content of the metadata elements.

xf:select1.xf:label: Script:
xf:select1.xf:hint: This attribute specifies the script used within individual elements, using codes from ISO 15924 (Code for the representation of names of scripts).

xf:select1.xf:label: Transliteration:
xf:select1.xf:hint: It specifies the transliteration technique used within individual elements. There is no standard list of transliteration schemes available, although one may be developed.

xf:input.xf:label: Display Label:
xf:input.xf:hint: This attribute is intended to be used when additional text associated with the title is needed for display.

xf:input.xf:label: Access Condition:
xf:input.xf:hint: Information about restrictions imposed on access to a resource.
